vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
Μάγος [ᾰ], ου, ὁ,
“Magian”, one of a Median tribe, [Refs 5th c.BC+]: hence, as belonging to this tribe,
__2 one of the priests and wise men in Persia who interpreted dreams, [NT+5th c.BC+]
__3 enchanter, wizard, especially in bad sense, impostor, charlatan, [NT+5th c.BC+]
__II μάγος, ον, as adjective, magical, μάγῳ τέχνῃ πράττειν τι [Refs 1st c.BC+]. (Opers. maguš 'Magian'.)
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
sorcerer; (plural) Magimagus
(1) a magus, sage of the magician religion, magician, astrologer, wise man, Mt. 2:1, 7, 16; (2) a magician, sorcerer, Acts 13:6, 8*
